data.title: PHIL URSO — The Philosophy Of Urso-1953-1959 Sessions
data.meta_description: The Philosophy Of Urso-1953-1959 Sessions is a cool jazz music boxset / compilation recording by PHIL URSO released in 2016  on CD, LP/Vinyl and/or cassette. This page includes PHIL URSO The Philosophy Of Urso-1953-1959 Sessions's : cover picture, songs / tracks list, members/musicians and line-up, different releases details, buy online: ebay and amazon, ratings and detailled reviews by some experts, collaborators and members.
data.text:
Boxset / Compilation · 2016

Tracklist

Disk 1

1 Little Pres

2 Three Little Words

3 Don't Take Your Love from Me

4 She's Funny That Way

5 Chiketa

6 Stop Watch

7 Wizzard's Gizzards

8 Ozzie's Ode

9 It's Only a Paper Moon

10 Too Marvelous for Words

11 Extra Mild

12 Squeeze Me

13 Blues #One

14 Satin Doll

15 Pent-Up House

16 Line for Lyons

17 Star Eyes

18 Dag's Scene

Disk 2

1 My Heart Stood Still

2 Easy Out

3 This Can't Be Love

4 Lush Tush

5 Where or When

6 My Heart Tells Me

7 Blues to Remember Her By

8 They Can't Take That Away from Me

9 Moonlight Serenade

10 A Woman In Love

11 Sentimental Journey

12 11th Hour Melody

13 Nothing Ever Changes My Love for You

14 Diane

15 Memories of You

16 The Pendulum at Falcon's Lair

17 Tamalpais [Song of Love to the Winds]

18 Jack the Fieldstalker

19 Stockholm Sweetnin'

20 Low and Behold

Line-up/Musicians

PERSONNEL ON CD 1:

PHIL URSO, tenor sax on all tracks with:

[1-4:] PHIL URSO QUARTET

WALTER BISHOP Jr, piano

CLYDE LOMBARDI, bass

HOWIE MAN, drums

Hackensack, New Jersey, April 14, 1953

[5-8]: PHIL URSO-BOB BROOKMEYER QUINTET

BOB BROOKEMEYER, trombone

HORACE SILVER, piano

PERCY HEATH, bass

KENNY CLARKE, drums

Hackensack, New Jersey, April 30, 1954

[9-10]: PHIL URSO QUARTET & QUINTET

BOB BURGESS, trombono on track 9 only

BOBBY TIMMONS, piano

JIMMY BOND, bass

PETER LITTMAN, drums

Hollywood, October 18, 1956

[11-18]: PHIL URSO QUARTET & QUINTET

RON WASHINGTON, tenor sax

DAGWOOD WALTON, Hammond organ

GENE KLINGMAN, bass

JO JO WILLIAMS, drums

Louisville, Colorado, 1959

PERSONNEL ON CD 2:

[1-5]: PHIL URSO accompanied by BOBBY BANKS

BOOBY BANKS, organ

Hackensack, New Jersey, February 18, 1954

[6-15]: Same personnel as above but Rodney “Red” Alcott, drums, added.

Hackensack, New Jersey, March 27, 1956

[16-20] BONUS TRACKS: THE NEW OSCAR PETTIFORD SEXTET

JULIUS WATKINS, french horn

WALTER BISHOP Jr, piano

OSCAR PETTIFORD, cello or bass only on track 17

CHARLES MINGUS, bass, except track 17

PERCY BRICE, drums on track 20

The only soloists are Pettiford and Bishop.

New York, December 29, 1953.

About this release

Fresh Sound FSRCD 889 (Spain)

SOURCES CD 1:

[1-4] from the 7” EP NEW TRENDS OF JAZZ Vol.12” (Savoy XP-8059)

(Also issued on the 10” LP “Phil Urso and Bob Brookmeyer” (Savoy MG 15041))

[5-8] from the 10” LP PHIL URSO AND BOB BROOMEYER (Savoy MG 15041)

[1-8] also issued on the 12” LP THE PHILOSOPHY OF URSO (Savoy MG 12056)

[9] from the 10” LP SOLO FLIGHT (Jazz West Coast JWC-505)

[10] from AN ANTHOLOGY OF CALIFORNIA MUSIC , Vol. 3” (Jazz West Coast JWC-507)

[11-18] from THE JOMAR DAGRON QUARTET FEATURING PHIL URSO (Legacy MK 1050)

SOURCES CD 2:

[1-5] from the LP THE PHILOSOPHY OF URSO (Savoy MG 12056)

[6-15] from the LP SENTIMENTAL JOURNEY (Regent MG 6003)

[16-20] from the 10” LP THE NEW OSCAR PETTIFORD SEXTET (Debut DLP 8)
